alert.note: Alert for Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 9:58PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cherry County through 1045 PM CDT... At 958 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Cody to 8 miles southeast of Merriman to 16 miles southeast of Gordon. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cody, Nenzel, Medicine Lake, Cody Lake, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Eli, Highway 61 Crossing The Niobrara River and Intersection of Highway 61 and Shadbolt Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 143 and 171. Highway 61 between mile markers 198 and 218. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
